FuncDef:
The fr lmi n393dce command configures the total number of monitored events (N393) used for LMI negotiation on a DCE.
The undo fr lmi n393dce command restores the default configuration.
By default, the N393 value is 4 on the DCE.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the total number of monitored events (N393) used for LMI negotiation on a DCE.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Local Management Interface (LMI) is a protocol that uses status enquiry messages and state messages to maintain link and PVC status, and its working process is as follows:
A DCE requests a status enquiry message from a DTE at an interval specified by T392. If the DCE does not receive a status enquiry message during this interval, the DCE records the error and increases the number of error events by 1. If the total number of error events in the monitored events (N393) reaches the error threshold N392, the DCE considers the physical link and all VCs unavailable. To configure the total number of monitored events (N393) on a DCE, run the fr lmi n393dce command.
Prerequisites
The FR interface type has been set to DCE using the fr interface-type command.
Configuration Impact
Running the fr lmi n393dce command changes the N393 value and affects the error threshold, which in turn affects the LMI negotiation rate.
If the fr lmi n393dce command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
The value of N392 must be smaller than that of N393 on a DCE.
